Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2010 07:32AM laurakay wrote: I still haven't heard--obviously, Nancy, you haven't either.  Maria:  the core biopsy was not that terrible.  All the prep took a long time, but the procedure itself was one minute.  I felt fine afterward (you're completely numbed), and then had some bleeding, but mostly because, I think, stupidly I carried a huge thing of kitty litter into the house.  Don't lift anything!  One thing that helped me was that I kept asking them 'how much longer?' which probably annoyed them, but I was able to watch the clock, and I just kept adding twenty minutes to whatever they said, and knew I could make it.  But this waiting is unbearable.  At least they've told you it will be two weeks, right?  So, truly, tell yourself you won't think about it for at least ten days.  I know that seems impossible, but at least it's a goal.      I hesitate to mention this, because of what we're all going through, but was hoping someone might have some reassuring words.  My mother died of breast cancer, and she was exactly two years older than I am now.  It's very hard not to just assume that's where I'm headed.  People keep telling , me, however, that things are very different than they were twenty-five years ago.  Plus, my mother's was not caught early.  If I have bc, it's early.  Right. My heart is with you all.  Laura
